It at once unmasks itself by proposing to slash the interest rate on EPF deposits to a four-decade low nadir," CM Banerjee tweeted.

174.title: Have trouble sitting idle, sitting quietly for 5 mins feels like waste of time: Nooyi
174.article_body: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the Jaipur Literature Festival 2022 spoke about what motivated her. She said, "When I sit quietly, I feel I have wasted five minutes of my time. I'm constantly thinking about how to change the world or to help somebody...I have trouble sitting idle. That's why meditation has never been a part of my life."

175.title: Vicky wishes 'Uri' director Aditya Dhar on b'day, shares pic from set
175.article_body: Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram to wish 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' director Aditya Dhar on his birthday. He shared a picture from the set of the 2019 action drama and wrote, "Happy birthday mere Bhai. Lots of love!" Responding to his post, Aditya wrote, "Love you!!" Vicky and Aditya have teamed up for another film titled, 'The Immortal Ashwatthama'.

176.title: She tries to do more than she has to: WV Raman on Smriti's 123 in WC
176.article_body: Talking about Smriti Mandhana's 119-ball 123 against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, ex-India Women head coach WV Raman said the India opener always tries to surpass herself. "She tries to do more than she has to but here she didn't get into that mode...she was calm," he stated. "It was a fabulous innings," he further said.

177.title: Jagdev's membership was cancelled over 3 months ago: BJD MP Misra
177.article_body: Biju Janata Dal (BJD) has denied links with MLA Prashant Jagdev who's accused of ramming his car into a crowd that injured 22 people in Khordha, Odisha. BJD MP Pinaki Misra said, "BJD membership of Jagdev was cancelled more than three months ago after his suspension by party president Naveen Patnaik." He assured that "law will take its own course".

178.title: Valuables worth ₹29 lakh stolen from Mumbai jeweller's home, 5 held
178.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested five people following a robbery at a jeweller's house in which gold ornaments and cash worth ₹29.60 lakh were looted. Those arrested include the jeweller's estranged brother who allegedly masterminded the burglary. According to police, three armed men had barged into the house on March 10 and threatened the jeweller's family members before fleeing with valuables.

179.title: Gurugram civic body demolishes 40 shanties in 2-day drive
179.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has demolished 40 shanties in Sector 40, Sector 54, Sector 56, and Sector 57 during a two-day drive last week, officials said. Around two acres of prime civic land were recovered during the drive, officials said. There was no major resistance from the locals during the drive, they added.

180.title: I'd pay to watch him bowl: Irfan on Bumrah's 8th 5-wicket Test haul vs SL
180.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah for his eighth five-wicket Test haul against Sri Lanka in second Test, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan tweeted, "I would pay to watch Bumrah bowl. What a bowler!" The India pacer, who registered bowling figures of 10-4-24-5, dismissed Niroshan Dickwella (21) for his fifth wicket. Notably, the Sri Lankan wicketkeeper-batter's wicket was Bumrah's 300th international wicket.

181.title: 21-yr-old Indian fighting Russian forces in Ukraine willing to return to India: Report
181.article_body: R Sainikhesh, a 21-year-old aerospace engineering student from Tamil Nadu who joined the Ukrainian paramilitary force as a volunteer to fight the Russian forces, has reportedly expressed his willingness to return to his home in Coimbatore. Sainikhesh's father spoke to him three days ago, during which Sainikhesh had expressed his willingness to return home, PTI reported quoting his family sources.

182.title: UK to offer support for probe on Russian 'war crimes' in Ukraine
182.article_body: UK Deputy PM Dominic Raab will visit International Criminal Court in The Hague on Monday to offer support for probing alleged war crimes by Russia in Ukraine, UK government said. "Russian commanders carrying out war crimes should know they can't act with impunity," Raab said. Raab will also meet ambassadors from other countries to build coalition focused on aiding investigation.

183.title: Gujarat gets new sports policy, to set up 4 new High Performance Centres
183.article_body: The Gujarat government has unveiled its sports policy (2022-27) in which the state will get four new High Performance Centre (HPCs) for elite athletes out of which one will be exclusively for para-athletes. The policy also promises to set up a sports goods manufacturing cluster in the state and encourages private sector participation in setting up HPCs and others.

184.title: Unification of MCDs needed as Delhi govt blocking funds: Gambhir
184.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir has said that the unification of municipal corporations of Delhi (MCDs) has been necessitated due to state government's blocking of funds given by the Centre for the civic bodies. Notably, the announcement of dates for municipal polls in Delhi was postponed following a communication from the Centre to State Election Commission on unification of civic bodies.

185.title: Dhoni was completely opposite of what I thought captaincy would've looked like: Faf du Plessis
185.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis said that MS Dhoni was the complete opposite of what he thought captaincy would've looked like. "I came to...CSK...and I was like 'This guy is completely different than I thought what it should be'," he added. "What it taught me was...there were different styles, but it's important that you...have your own style," he stated.

186.title: Andhra boy lives with mother's body for 4 days thinking she's asleep; goes to school daily
186.article_body: A 10-year-old boy in Andhra Pradesh stayed with his mother's dead body for four days, thinking she was sleeping. He went to school every day by dressing up himself, ate snacks at home and slept beside his mother. The incident was reported after the boy called his uncle to inform him about a foul smell emanating from his mother's body.

187.title: Ambedkar musical at JLN Stadium to go on till March 24: Delhi govt
187.article_body: The musical on the life of BR Ambedkar will go on till March 24 at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Delhi, after receiving a "tremendous response" from the public, Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's office said. The script of the musical comprises social commentary on the plight of the Dalit community. The musical was scheduled to end on March 12 earlier.

188.title: Man arrested for raping 2 minor daughters in Maharashtra's Palghar
188.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Sunday for allegedly raping his two minor daughters, currently aged six and 12, repeatedly since 2019 after their mother's death, police said. A complaint was registered after the victims approached an NGO. The victims told police that he would point a knife and threaten to kill them whenever they resisted.

189.title: Shimron Hetmyer sports pink hair as he joins RR for IPL 2022, franchise shares pic
189.article_body: Shimron Hetmyer has sported pink hair as he joined Rajasthan Royals for IPL 2022. The franchise shared a picture of Hetmyer joining the team and wrote, "Love is in the hair...Welcome home!" "West Indians bring a very spicy flair to IPL," a fan commented. Hetmyer was bought by RR for ₹8.5 crore in the IPL mega auction.

190.title: Gandhi family important for Congress' unity: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
190.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that the Gandhi family is important for Congress' unity. He added that Rahul Gandhi should once again become the party chief. On the party's recent loss in Punjab polls, Gehlot said, "It was our mistake that due to internal conflict we lost the assembly elections in Punjab."

191.title: Ranbir-Alia's new house to have a room dedicated to Rishi Kapoor: Report
191.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's new house in Mumbai will reportedly have a special room dedicated to his late father Rishi Kapoor. The Kapoor family has preserved each and every memory of the late actor, including a bookshelf, his favourite chair, and other things, the report quoted a source as saying. All these things will be kept in the room.

192.title: Was nice to rebuild with Beth Mooney: Ellyse Perry on win vs NZ
192.article_body: Following a 141-run win against New Zealand Women in the Women's ODI World Cup, Australia Women all-rounder Ellyse Perry said it was nice to rebuild the innings with batter Beth Mooney. Australia Women were down to 56/3, however, Perry, Mooney, Tahlia McGrath and Ashleigh Gardner powered Australia to 269 runs. In reply, New Zealand were bowled out on 128 runs.

193.title: Poor batting performance from us: NZ captain Devine on loss vs Aus
193.article_body: After a 141-run defeat against Australia Women in the Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand captain Sophie Devine said that her side put up a poor batting performance in the match. In reply to Australia's 269 runs, New Zealand Women were bowled out on 128 runs. "The way Australians set it up (with the bat), that's the blueprint," Devine added.

194.title: Don't see Marvel going from Hugh to me: Daniel on rumours of playing Wolverine
194.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe, responding to rumours of portraying the character of Wolverine, stated that he doesn't see Marvel going from actor Hugh Jackman to him. The actor added, "But who knows? Prove me wrong, Marvel." Daniel further said that people have been congratulating him on the news about playing Wolverine but he doesn't know anything about it.

195.title: Terrific decision by RCB to appoint Du Plessis as captain: Gavaskar
195.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that Royal Challengers Bangalore took a terrific decision by appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for IPL 2022. "Loads of captaincy experience, loads of leadership quality you see in Du Plessis. I am not surprised at all," Gavaskar stated. Du Plessis was bought by RCB for ₹7 crore in IPL 2022 mega auction.

196.title: Why is letter 'Z' being used by Russians to show support to the war in Ukraine?
196.article_body: The letter 'Z' is being used by Russian politicians, influencers and others to show support to President Vladimir Putin's actions in Ukraine. Russian Defence Ministry explained that the 'Z' represents a number of slogans that begin with the Russian word for 'for' (Za), like 'For Victory' or 'For Peace'. The symbol has also earlier been used to intimidate government critics.

197.title: 5 members of family killed, 1 injured as car hits culvert in Andhra Pradesh
197.article_body: Five members of a family, including a six-month-old baby, died and another person was injured after the car they were travelling in lost control and crashed into a culvert in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna district on Sunday, police said. The deceased, all residents of HUDA colony in Hyderabad, were on their way to West Godavari district to attend a family function.

198.title: I won't mind if people call me 'Baahubali' star forever: Prabhas
198.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said that he won't mind if people call him a 'Baahubali' star for the rest of his life. "'Baahubali' gave me so many things...The issue is the expectations set after 'Baahubali'," the actor added. Prabhas further said that there is definitely some kind of pressure after being recognised in the whole country and not just one state.

199.title: Mumbai BJP workers burn copies of police notice sent to Fadnavis
199.article_body: The BJP workers in Mumbai on Sunday protested against a police notice sent to former CM Devendra Fadnavis in connection with the alleged illegal tapping of phones. They also burnt copies of the police notice. Several BJP leaders gathered outside Fadnavis's home in south Mumbai where a cyber police team reached to record his statement in this case.

200.title: Dollar-denominated debt is bad idea, exposes one to Fed's moods: Zoho CEO
200.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that dollar-denominated debt is a bad idea. "They leave companies and the country exposed to the Fed's (the US' Federal Reserve) mood swings," he explained. Vembu was commenting on a Twitter thread by Human Rights Foundation's Alex Gladstein. "The fiat/petrodollar system can be considered a form of neocolonialism," Gladstein wrote in the tweet.

201.title: Faced ups & downs on my own: Zareen on being called 'Salman Khan actress'
201.article_body: Actress Zareen Khan, who made her debut in 2010 with Salman Khan-starrer film 'Veer', spoke about being tagged as a 'Salman Khan actress' and said that she'll forever be grateful to him for making her a part of the industry. "But that's about it...I've faced the ups and downs on my own and I've dealt with my struggles," she added.

202.title: Kohli needs to play as much as possible with full face of bat: Gavaskar
202.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the 33-year-old needs to try and eliminate the shots that are getting him out. "That shot he played [during India's first innings in ongoing Bengaluru Test] wasn't the shot he should have played. [Kohli needs to] play as much as possible with the full face of the bat," stated Gavaskar.

203.title: Union Minister's sons booked for linking Sharad Pawar to Dawood Ibrahim
203.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane's sons, Nitesh and Nilesh, have been booked for accusing NCP supremo Sharad Pawar of having links with the fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim. The complaint was filed by NCP leader Suraj Chavan, Mumbai Police said. Earlier on Saturday, Chavan had questioned Nilesh's demand for the resignation of state Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik.

204.title: BJP propagated Cong as a Muslim party: Rajasthan CM
204.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said BJP propagated Congress "as a Muslim party on social media". "During polls, religion comes to the forefront while issues of inflation and jobs take a back seat for BJP," he added. We lost the Assembly elections in Punjab due to internal conflict, Gehlot said.

205.title: Forced to change our statement by police: Wife of deceased tribal
205.article_body: After Manuram Nureti was killed in a 'police encounter' in Bastar, his wife Manvati wrote to Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel alleging that they were being "forced to change their statement" in favour of the police. The police had labelled the 26-year-old a 'Maoist' but later retracted their own claim stating that he was "a normal villager...killed in a crossfire".

206.title: Delhi railway reservation services to be inactive on Sunday late night
206.article_body: The Delhi Passenger Reservation System (PRS) will remain inactive for about 3.5 hours between 11:45 pm on March 13 and 3:15 am on March 14, said Indian Railways on Sunday. The services such as reservation of tickets, cancellations, internet booking, charting, PRS enquiry on 139 will not be accessible to the public during this time.

207.title: Female representation in Indian judiciary 'abysmal': Justice Banerjee
207.article_body: Justice Indira Banerjee said the representation of women in the Indian judiciary has been "abysmal" since independence. "Delhi High Court has seven women judges, out of a total of 45. Calcutta High Court has five women judges, out of 39 judges," she said. Only 11.8% of incumbent high court judges are women, said Chief Justice of India NV Ramana.

208.title: Wedding procession attacked in UP for playing song praising PM Modi, CM Yogi
208.article_body: The members of a wedding procession were allegedly beaten up and their vehicles were vandalised by unidentified miscreants in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya for playing an election-themed song praising PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath. The accused allegedly escaped with cash worth ₹2 lakh and jewellery. Police said a case has been registered and search is underway to trace attackers.

209.title: Notice B'wood's silence on 'The Kashmir Files', their time is up: Kangana
209.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Sunday appreciated Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' on social media, adding that there's pin-drop silence in Bollywood about it. She also appreciated the film for breaking myths about bringing audiences to theatres. Kangana further wrote, "Bullydawood aur unke chamche sadme mein chale gaye hain (Bollywood bullies and their cronies are in shock)...Their time is upp!"

210.title: Anupam Kher starrer 'The Kashmir Files' declared tax-free in Gujarat
210.article_body: The Gujarat government has declared 'The Kashmir Files', starring actor Anupam Kher, as tax-free in the state. The film's maker Vivek Agnihotri thanked Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel. Earlier, Haryana had announced the tax-free status for the film and asked cinemas and multiplexes to not charge state GST on the movie.

211.title: Delhi's Class 9, 11 students to be promoted as per 2020-21 policy
211.article_body: Delhi's Class 9 and 11 students will be promoted based on the promotion policy of 2020-21, the Delhi Directorate of Education said. All government, government-aided and private schools are required to follow the policy. Results of Classes 9 and 11 will be calculated for promotion with passing criteria of 33% in each of the five subjects students are studying.

212.title: Organisational failure to blame for UP poll defeat: Shivpal Yadav
212.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohia) chief Shivpal Singh Yadav said on Sunday that while the atmosphere was conducive for party to win in UP Assembly elections, it suffered from organisational failure. Yadav, whose party had allied with Samajwadi Party (SP) for polls, added that they welcome people's mandate and will work towards strengthening the organisation. SP won 111 seats in polls.

213.title: Actress Rupaa Dutta held for pickpocketing at fair; kept a diary of her theft record
213.article_body: Bengali actress Rupaa Dutta, who had once wrongly accused Anurag Kashyap of sending her inappropriate messages, has been arrested for allegedly pickpocketing at a Kolkata book fair. The police found ₹65,760 from her bag and a diary in which she had maintained an account of her stealing. Rupaa admitted that she was picking the pocket at the crowded fair.

214.title: NIA arrests 6 people for trafficking Rohingya Muslims into India
214.article_body: The NIA arrested six people who were allegedly part of a syndicate involved in the illegal trafficking of Rohingya Muslims into Indian territory, an official said. The network was operating in the border areas of West Bengal, Assam and Meghalaya as well as other parts of the country, the official added.

215.title: Make all efforts to bring back mortal remains of Indian student who died in Ukraine: PM
215.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Security to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. During the meeting, PM Modi directed that all possible efforts should be made to bring back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who died in Ukraine.

216.title: Kyiv is always beautiful, even during war: Zelenskyy's advisors in video from Kyiv
216.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's close advisors recently shared a video from the country's capital, Kyiv, on social media. In a tweet, Mykhailo Podolyak, an Advisor to the Head of the President's Office, wrote, "Kyiv is always beautiful. Even during wartime." A correspondent also quoted them as saying, "It's a shame the city is so empty but we did find coffee!"

217.title: Naomi Osaka breaks down after woman in crowd says 'You suck', video surfaces
217.article_body: Naomi Osaka broke down in the post-match interview after her defeat against Veronika Kudermetova in round of 64 of Indian Wells Masters. Earlier, a woman in the crowd shouted, "Naomi, you suck." Osaka said being heckled didn't bother her, but an old video of Serena Williams and Venus Williams being heckled at the same tournament replayed in her mind.

218.title: I find things chilly, I'm thin: World's largest air-conditioning firm Daikin's CEO
218.article_body: Masanori Togawa, the 73-year-old CEO of the world's largest air-conditioning company Daikin, while speaking about his personal air-conditioning usage, said, "I tend to find things chilly; I'm thin and don't have enough muscle!" He told Bloomberg, "But we're based in Osaka, which is brutally hot during the summer. There's no way we can survive there without air conditioning."

219.title: People in UP feel it's their own govt, not of some particular community: Piyush Goyal
219.article_body: Following BJP’s victory in four states including UP, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said that people in UP now feel that it is their "own" government and not the government of a particular community. Commenting on BJP’s performance in Punjab, Goyal stated that the BJP has increased its influence in the state significantly.

220.title: He's like my real brother: Zeeshan on 'Bloody Brothers' co-star Jaideep
220.article_body: Actor Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub has said actor Jaideep Ahlawat is like his real brother. "It's been 11-12 years that I have known him," he added. Zeeshan Ayyub, who shares screen space with Jaideep in 'Bloody Brothers', added that they got time to understand each other more while working on the show. "We...ended up making great memories," he said.

221.title: Looking forward to playing with Bumrah: MI's Mills ahead of IPL 2022
221.article_body: MI pacer Tymal Mills, who was bought by the franchise for ₹1.5 crore in IPL mega auction 2022, said he's looking forward to playing with Jasprit Bumrah in upcoming season of IPL . "Had the chance to spend a little bit of time with Bumrah during the World Cup," he added. The England pacer had previously represented RCB in IPL.

222.title: Over 55,000 cases settled in Rachakonda during Lok Adalat session
222.article_body: As many as 55,772 cases in Rachakonda Police Commissionerate were settled during National Lok Adalat at the Ranga Reddy District Court on Saturday. Of the cases settled, 51,318 were Disaster Management Act and e-petty cases, 3,025 cases had been filed under IPC and 1,429 cases were related to drunken driving. Lok Adalat was supervised by Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat.

223.title: 3 arrested for selling rice from ration shops in black market in Pune
223.article_body: Three people have been arrested in the Pune district for allegedly selling rice and wheat from government ration shops at higher prices in the black market. A truck carrying 358 wheat bags and 605 rice bags, all worth ₹28.29 lakh, was also seized from them. The Pimpri Chinchwad Police has also booked five others in this connection.

224.title: Pune Metro's Bhosari station's name creating confusion: Commuters
224.article_body: Commuters have said that Pune Metro's Bhosari station's name is "creating confusion" as it's located at a distance from residential areas. One local said that his relatives took an auto to reach Bhosari which is five-six km away from Bhosari station, as the station is in Nashik Phata. A Maha-Metro spokesperson said that they're thinking of changing Bhosari station's name.

225.title: Anand Mahindra shares video of Cong leader Deora's music performance, calls him 'cool'
225.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video featuring Congress leader Milind Deora, where the latter can be seen playing the guitar onstage at the Mahindra Blues Festival. Mahindra also mentioned that Deora goes by the stage name of MD Mississippi. He wrote, "His party is the INC, & with him, the 'C' stands for Cool!"

226.title: There's lack of confidence: Wasim Jaffer on Virat Kohli's form
226.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's dismissal in the first innings against Sri Lanka in the ongoing pink-ball Test, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said, "Once Kohli gets a hundred...I am quite sure that we will get to see the old Kohli." Jaffer added, "[Currently], there is a lack of confidence. The kind of runs that we expect from Kohli [are] not seen."

227.title: Mumbai's maximum temperature rises to 38.9°C, highest in Maharashtra
227.article_body: The maximum temperature in Mumbai on Sunday rose to 38.9°C, which is 5.4°C above normal. The city's maximum temperature is also the highest reported in Maharashtra. People shared memes online about the rising temperatures. "I feel like I am in the Sahara desert," a user wrote on Twitter.

228.title: Ukrainians who told Russian ship 'go f*** yourself' honoured with postage stamp
228.article_body: Ukraine is honouring 13 of its soldiers who told a Russian warship "go f*** yourself!" by releasing a postage stamp, the country's First Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Emine Dzheppar said. "The sketch by artist Boris Groh...will soon be published by Ukraine's state postal company," said Dzheppar. The soldiers had famously refused to surrender Snake Island to Russian forces.

229.title: 2 kill man who objected to their eve-teasing, smoking in B'luru
229.article_body: The police are searching for two brothers who allegedly killed a 19-year-old man who had repeatedly objected to the duo's eve-teasing and smoking near his house in Bengaluru. The duo had reportedly got enraged after the deceased complained to their father about the same and had attacked him. The duo had also apparently mocked the sister of the deceased's friend.

230.title: Big B signed papers for Amjad's surgery after accident: Shehla Khan
230.article_body: Shehla Khan recalled the time when she and her late actor-husband Amjad Khan met with an accident in Maharashtra's Sawantwadi. She revealed that Amjad had to be shifted to Goa because a mob had gathered outside the hospital in Sawantwadi. "That's when Amitabh (Bachchan) ji gave his signature for...doctors to proceed with...tracheostomy (a surgical procedure to ease breathing)," Shehla added.

231.title: Ukraine to adopt crop sowing campaign to ensure food security: PM
231.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal said on Sunday that the country will adopt crop sowing campaign in a bid to ensure food security amid the Russian invasion. Shmyhal added that while Ukraine has sufficient volume of basic food products for next few months, it must "think about the future". Notably, Ukraine has also banned export of wheat and other food staples.

232.title: Jasprit Bumrah takes his first Test five-wicket haul on Indian soil
232.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah today completed his first five-wicket haul in Test cricket on Indian soil. The 28-year-old registered bowling figures of 10-4-24-5 in Sri Lanka's first innings in the ongoing Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. Overall, it is Bumrah's eighth five-wicket haul in Test cricket. Sri Lanka were dismissed for 109 runs in the first innings.

233.title: Nawazuddin is among the best actors in the country: Bhumi Pednekar
233.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar in an interview has called actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui one of the best actors in the country, adding that he is a stalwart in cinema. "I have waited long for an opportunity to work with Nawaz sir...I am going to learn so much from him," Bhumi added. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Afwaah'.

234.title: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 7.9%
234.article_body: Morgan Stanley has cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 by 50 basis points to 7.9% and raised retail inflation projection to 6%. The firm also expects current account deficit to widen to a 10-year high of 3% of GDP. High oil prices, trade and tighter financial conditions are expected to affect the Indian economy in FY23.

235.title: Virat Kohli imitates Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action, video goes viral
235.article_body: A video of former Team India captain Virat Kohli imitating Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action during an innings break on the first day of the second Test against Sri Lanka has gone viral. Kohli was also seen imitating actions of other bowlers. Cricketer-turned-commentator Irfan Pathan commented that Kohli makes the atmosphere of the dressing room "amazing".

236.title: Russia conducts airstrike on Ukrainian military base near Poland border
236.article_body: Russia launched an airstrike on a Ukrainian military base in Yavoriv which lies just about 25 km from the Polish border, authorities in Lviv said on Sunday. "According to preliminary data, they fired eight missiles," said the authorities. "There are no dead but information about the injured and wounded is being clarified," said a Ukrainian official.

237.title: Startups must help India become self-reliant in energy, defence: Goyal
237.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal urged startups to help India become self-reliant in energy and defence sectors. "The present Ukraine-Russia crisis is a wakeup call for all of us, not to be dependent on crude oil and defence equipment," he said. Giving an example of how startups dealt with COVID-19 crisis, he said, "Every crisis can be converted into an opportunity."

238.title: One of the scariest moments of my life, I suffered a blood clot in my brain: Hailey
238.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, singer Justin Bieber's wife, confirmed on Instagram that she was hospitalised after suffering stroke-like symptoms. The 25-year-old wrote, "I suffered a very small blood clot to my brain, which caused a small lack of oxygen, but my body passed it on its own." She went on to call it "one of the scariest moments" of her life.

239.title: US man goes to Ukraine to save daughter & grandson, says 'That's what dads do'
239.article_body: A US man has gone to Ukraine to help his daughter and grandson escape. William Hubbard flew to Poland and crossed the border to Ukraine on foot before joining his daughter and 8-month-old grandson near Kyiv. On Friday, the three reached the border at Slovakia. "That's what dads do. They take care of their family," Hubbard said.

240.title: Reports on CEO's arrest for rash driving exaggerated, no harm was caused: Paytm
240.article_body: Responding to reports of Paytm founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's arrest and subsequent bail in a case of rash driving in February, a company spokesperson called it a "minor incident". The spokesperson added that no harm was caused to any person or property due to it and that media reports claiming the nature of the arrest are exaggerated.

241.title: Woman raped inside bus in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar; 2 arrested
241.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly raping a woman inside a bus in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar. A search is underway to find another accused, Dhar SP said. Police said bus driver, conductor and cleaner did not drop the woman at her destination Longsari. After all other passengers left, the accused stopped the bus at a secluded place and raped her.

242.title: No dirty water will flow into Yamuna by December-end, says NMCG official
242.article_body: No dirty water will be flowing into the Yamuna by December-end as all drains carrying sewage into the river will be tapped, a senior NMCG official said. There are 18 drains that deliver dirty water into the Yamuna and plans are afoot to tap these drains and divert dirty water to sewage treatment plants, NMCG Director-General, G Asok Kumar, said.

243.title: Thousands of Russian tourists stuck in Thailand amid Ukraine war
243.article_body: Thousands of Russian tourists running short of cash are reportedly stranded in Thailand as they are unable to return due to various sanctions and cancelled flights over war in Ukraine. There are about 6,500 Russian tourists stuck in Phuket, Surat Thani, Krabi and Pattaya, in addition to 1,000 Ukrainians, said the Governor of Tourism Authority of Thailand.

244.title: US authorises $200 million for additional weapons to Ukraine
244.article_body: US government on Saturday said that it has given "immediate" authorisation $200 million for additional arms and equipment to Ukraine for its defence amid Russia's invasion of the country. US State Secretary Antony Blinken said that this will help Ukraine meet "armoured, airborne and other threats it's facing". This brings US aid to Ukraine since January 2021 to $1.2 billion.

245.title: You got BMW within 1 year, I can't buy 2nd hand Porsche?: Ashneer to BharatPe CEO
245.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Sunday in a tweet responded to the claims of his "lavish lifestyle", including owning a Porsche car. "I am proud Suhail Sameer (BharatPe's CEO) that within 1 year of joining BharatPe you could buy BMW Z4 convertible sports car," Ashneer tweeted. He added, "Ironic that you believe...as Founder (I) can't even afford a 2nd hand Porsche. Touché!!"

246.title: UK govt offers ₹35,000/month to residents to house Ukrainian refugees
246.article_body: Britain will pay its citizens £350 (around ₹35,000) per month if they offer Ukrainian refugees a spare room or property for a minimum period of six months. The government said the new scheme called "Homes for Ukraine" will allow refugees to come to Britain even if they don't have family ties. Notably, about 2 million people have already fled Ukraine.

247.title: 38 held from fake Gurugram call centre for extortion on pretext of loan recovery
247.article_body: Police busted a fake call centre in Gurugram's Sector 20 and arrested 38 people. The accused used to allegedly extort money from loan borrowers by threatening to send their morphed photos and videos to friends and relatives on pretext of recovering the loan amount. Police claimed the accused extorted nearly ₹2 crore till date. They called around 700 people regularly.

248.title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting on India's security preparedness
248.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a high-level meeting to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, S Jaishankar and Nirmala Sitharaman were seen taking part in the meeting with PM Modi. NSA Ajit Doval and Foreign Secretary Harsh V Shringla also attended the meeting.

249.title: Wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted: Jatin Sarna on battling depression
249.article_body: 'Sacred Games' actor Jatin Sarna said that the last few years were quite hard and depressing for him. "I wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted...I felt...nothing was happening around me and started feeling...depressed...Moreover, I was staying alone," he added. Jatin said he didn't take "any clinical help" but "a year of introspection" and "close friends" helped him heal.

250.title: Bihar starts survey to prepare exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts
250.article_body: The Bihar government is in the process of preparing an exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts of the state to address the local environmental issues, BSPCB Member Secretary, S Chandrasekar, said. BSPCB has engaged an agency to conduct a survey in all the districts to prepare the district environment plan and the agency has started the work, he added.

251.title: 19 presumed dead as boat carrying 23 migrants capsizes near Libya
251.article_body: Authorities have said that 19 people are missing and presumed dead after a boat carrying about 23 migrants capsized in Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Libya on Saturday. Three people have been rescued and sent to the hospital, while one body has been retrieved, Libya's coast guard said. The boat had set off from Tobruk, the coast guard added.

252.title: Mumbai woman injured while trying to resist chain snatcher inside running train
252.article_body: A woman sustained injuries on her neck while trying to resist a suspected chain snatcher inside a running train in Mumbai. The woman was travelling to Churchgate in women's coach. When the train halted at Charni Road railway station, the accused entered the coach and tried to steal her gold chain. The woman resisted and chased the thief, who escaped.

253.title: PM Bennett did not ask Zelenskyy to take Putin's deal: Israel, Ukraine
253.article_body: A media report claiming that Israel PM Naftali Bennett suggested Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to give in to Russian demands was denied by both countries. "At no point did PM Bennett advise President Zelenskyy to take a deal from Putin," said an Israeli official. A Ukrainian adviser said Israel "does not offer Ukraine to agree to any demands" of Russia.

254.title: Arvind Kejriwal, Bhagwant Mann visit Golden Temple in Amritsar ahead of roadshow
254.article_body: Punjab CM designate Bhagwant Mann and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar, ahead of their roadshow to mark the party's victory in Punjab polls. Mann received Kejriwal and party leader Manish Sisodia at Amritsar airport today. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

255.title: Shatrughan Sinha, Babul Supriyo to fight for TMC in West Bengal bypolls: Mamata
255.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday took to Twitter to announce that veteran actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha will be TMC's candidate in Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Mamata further stated that singer and former Union Minister Babul Supriyo will be the party's candidate in Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat.

256.title: Massive fire that broke out at Kolkata tannery yet to be extinguished after 16 hrs
256.article_body: The massive fire which broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Tangra area of West Bengal's Kolkata on Saturday night, is yet to be extinguished even after over 16 hours. Officials said firefighters haven't been able to enter the godown due to the presence of some highly inflammable materials inside. Two fire brigade personnel have sustained injuries.

257.title: Punjab win gives AAP, our model of governance national recognition: Manish Sisodia
257.article_body: AAP leader Manish Sisodia said that the party’s massive victory in Punjab gives national recognition to the AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal’s model of governance. Sisodia added that when a political party becomes a credible alternative it's bound to emerge as a winner. "Right now, our priority is the people of Punjab. We will focus on fulfilling our promises," Sisodia stated.

258.title: At least 60 killed, dozens injured as Cargo train crashes in Congo
258.article_body: At least 60 people were killed and dozens injured after a cargo train crashed in Congo on Friday. The passengers had reportedly boarded the train illegally. "Seven of the carriages ended up in the ravine," said Clementine Lutanda, the local administrator. The accident occurred when the train fell off the track while going up a slope.

259.title: Ashneer Grover denies owning ₹10-cr dining table, says 'It's not even worth 0.5% of that'
259.article_body: Ashneer Grover has denied a report claiming he spent ₹10 crore on a dining table, saying, "It's not even worth 0.5% of that". He tweeted, "Is it a space rocket? Is it a time machine?...I don't hold Guinness World Record for the most expensive table...Press – don't fall for BharatPe Board (undisclosed sources) lies – you'll lose credibility like them."

260.title: WI earn draw vs Eng in 1st Test despite losing 4 wickets for 8 runs on final day
260.article_body: WI's Jason Holder and Nkrumah Bonner played a total of 239 deliveries on the final day of the first Test against England as the match ended in a draw. Joe Root slammed his 24th Test century in their second innings to help England set a target of 286 runs. WI were reduced to 67/4 before ending game at 147/4.

261.title: China's new local COVID-19 cases triple amid its worst outbreak
261.article_body: China reported 1,807 new local symptomatic coronavirus cases, more than triple than what was reported the previous day, the National Health Commission said on Sunday as the country faces its worst outbreak in two years. Of the total cases, Jilin province reported the highest at 1,412. Earlier, China locked down Jilin's provincial capital city Changchun over spike in COVID-19 cases.

262.title: For actors, performance trumps discomfort: Shruti on kissing Mugdha in show
262.article_body: Actress Shruti Seth, speaking about her on-screen kiss with Mugdha Godse in the upcoming series 'Bloody Brothers', said, "It was funny because both of us had never done a scene like it before." "Shaad (Ali, director) really put us at ease. And then for actors, the performance trumps discomfort so we eventually made it seem totally natural," she added.

263.title: Religious fanaticism, communal hysteria rising in country: RSS
263.article_body: Religious fanaticism and acts of communal hysteria are being spread in the country under the cover of the Constitution and religious freedom, the RSS said in its annual report. "Efforts are afoot to weaken the society by rising various fissiparous tendencies in the Hindu society itself," RSS said in the report.

264.title: Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills: Sachin to Sreesanth
264.article_body: After Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket, Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to congratulate the fast bowler. He wrote, "Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills. Congratulations @sreesanthnair36, on representing India over the years.  All the very best for your 2nd innings."

265.title: Posters criticising Venugopal surface in Kerala after Cong's defeat
265.article_body: Following Congress' defeat in Assembly polls, posters criticising party leader KC Venugopal have surfaced near a party office in Kerala's Kannur. The posters read- "Save Congress- thanks to Venugopal for what happened in five states where Congress was wiped out". State Congress chief K Sudhakaran reacted to this saying that everyone has a "collective responsibility for successes and failures".

266.title: Sonia, Rahul should discharge their duties properly: JD(U) chief
266.article_body: Janata Dal (United) president Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh has asked senior Congress leaders, Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, to "discharge their duties properly" in order to "save the decline of Congress". He further asked Congress to "come out with a proper roadmap" in the backdrop of the party's defeat in the five states' assembly elections.

267.title: RCB have made the right choice in appointing Plessis as captain: Karthik
267.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said RCB have made the right choice in appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for the upcoming season. "Faf is at that stage in his career when he's ready to take on the responsibility...he's a great tactician," stated Karthik, who'll also feature for the franchise this season. Karthik was bought by RCB for ₹5.5 crore.

268.title: People in Bollywood never saw me beyond my looks: Dino Morea
268.article_body: Actor Dino Morea in an interview said, "Being good looking sometimes works against you in Bollywood." "Directors don't see me differently. I just get...feedback that you're good looking...I find it...bizarre, what's my look got to do with casting me in a certain character. Just cast me. I can change my look," he said, adding, "People...never saw me beyond my looks."

269.title: CRPF jawan who was home on leave martyred in terror attack in J&K; 2 held
269.article_body: A 34-year-old CRPF jawan, who was home on leave, was martyred after terrorists fired upon him near his home in the Chotipora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Saturday evening. "He succumbed to his injuries while on way to a hospital," a police spokesperson said. Kashmir IGP said two persons have been arrested in connection with the terror crime.

270.title: Congress' Dipika Pandey resigns post debacle in Uttarakhand polls
270.article_body: Congress' Jharkhand MLA Dipika Pandey Singh has resigned as the national secretary, co-in charge of Uttarakhand after the party failed to win the Uttarakhand assembly elections. Singh said in a tweet that she takes "responsibility for the defeat in Uttarakhand" and "thank the leadership for giving the opportunity to serve Congress at the national level".

271.title: WI fined 40% of match fee for slow over-rate against India in Women's WC
271.article_body: West Indies have been fined 40% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against India in their match in the ongoing Women's Cricket World Cup. WI were found to be two overs short of the target after time allowances were taken into consideration. India won the match by 155 runs to register their second win in three games.

272.title: 4 killed as tipper truck hits autorickshaw in Punjab's Mohali
272.article_body: Four persons were killed in a road accident on Kharar-Kurali road, Mohali, after a tipper truck hit an auto-rickshaw. The accident occurred on Friday when the victims were coming towards Kharar to board a train to go to their native place in UP's Badaun district. The truck was seized and the driver was arrested, police said.

273.title: Men sexually harass girl one by one during festival in MP, onlookers record videos
273.article_body: Several men sexually harassed a girl on a street in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur during Bhagoria festival, which is celebrated by tribal people. Police registered a case after a video surfaced online. In the video, the girl was heard screaming as men molested her one by one, and onlookers were seen recording videos with their phones instead of helping the girl.

274.title: Man rapes 11-year-old step daughter in Gurugram, threatens to kill her; arrested
274.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 11-year-old step daughter and threatening to kill her in Gurugram on Saturday. According to police, the girl's mother filed a police complaint against the accused. In the complaint, she said some time after her husband died six years ago, she had married the accused, who is a native of Nepal.

275.title: Bengaluru NCB seize 1.97 kg pseudoephedrine; 2 arrested
275.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau's (NCB) Bengaluru unit has seized 1.97 kg of pseudoephedrine from a consignment headed to New Zealand at a courier centre in the city, officers said. Two people, including a South African national, have also been arrested in the matter. The consignment had 50 spools of metallic yarn, with each concealing about 40 gm of the drug.

276.title: It's not often you see such knocks on turning tracks: Irfan on Shreyas' 92 vs SL
276.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised Shreyas Iyer for his 92-run knock during India's first innings in the ongoing Test against Sri Lanka. "It was an innings of the highest class...The control was because of the clarity of thought, whether to play forward or back...You won't get to see such knocks on turning tracks often," Irfan stated.

277.title: Mother of AAP's Labh Singh who defeated Punjab CM continues working as sweeper
277.article_body: Baldev Kaur, mother of AAP's Labh Singh Ugoke who won from Bhadaur seat by defeating Congress' CS Channi in Punjab polls, continues to work as a sweeper at a government school in Ugoke village. "I take pride...that my son chose to join a party whose symbol is 'jhaadu', which I've used throughout my life to earn a livelihood," she said.

278.title: WI-Eng Test went on longer than needed, bit disrespectful: Carlos Brathwaite
278.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite has criticised England, stating that they were a "bit disrespectful" by agreeing to a draw in the first Test against West Indies only in the final over of the game. "With two set batsmen playing...and pitch offering nothing, England still felt they could [win]...Would they have done that against India, New Zealand, Pakistan?" asked Brathwaite.

279.title: Posing as customer, man steals car during test drive in Ludhiana
279.article_body: A female employee of an auto agency was robbed at gunpoint by a man who posed as a customer and escaped with SUV he took for a test drive near Doraha, Ludhiana. The accused was captured in the CCTVs installed in the showroom and his face was covered with a mask, Sewa Singh, sub-inspector at Sahnewal Police Station, said.

280.title: Sikkim plans to install vending machines for free sanitary pads in all govt schools
280.article_body: The Sikkim government is set to announce a scheme to install vending machines to provide free sanitary pads in its 210 secondary and senior secondary schools. The state government aims to curb dropout of girl students from schools and raise awareness about menstrual hygiene. "We'll also install incinerators...for proper disposal of pads," state Education Department's Secretary-in-Charge said.

281.title: Denied entry, man stabs 2 women employees at New York museum
281.article_body: A man reportedly stabbed two women employees multiple times at New York City's Museum of Modern Art after he was denied entry since his membership had expired.  The victims were immediately taken to the hospital and are expected to survive. The police said that the perpetrator is known to them and they are trying to locate him.

282.title: Chinese plane crashed into South China Sea on March 1: Taiwan
282.article_body: Taiwan's National Security Bureau Director-General Chen Ming-tong has confirmed that a China's People's Liberation Army Air Force plane had crashed into the South China Sea on March 1, Taiwan News reported. The report also said that Taiwanese media noticed a "sudden drop off" in Y-8 flights through the country's air defence identification zone. China hasn't acknowledged the incident, it added.

283.title: People think therapy is useless, it helped me so much: Jacqueline
283.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has said people think therapy is useless but it helped her a lot. She added that she sought help from a therapist because she was "going through loneliness" in 2020 during the COVID-19 induced lockdown. "I had this amazing therapist. I was doing therapy for some time. And it is amazing," Jacqueline further said.

284.title: Deleted a scene featuring Abhishek, Chunky in 'Bachchhan Paandey': Director
284.article_body: 'Bachchhan Paandey' director Farhad Samji revealed that they've deleted a scene featuring pictures of Abhishek Bachchan and Chunky Panday in the upcoming film. "Kriti and Arshad's characters were looking for Bachchhan Paandey and they ask a...kid if they'd seen him. The kid said yes and pulled out...magazine with pictures of Abhishek and Chunky. We didn't put this scene," he said.

285.title: 21-year-old BMW driver arrested in hit and run case in Delhi after 1 killed
285.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly killed 36-year-old Rahul Chand in a hit and run accident by his BMW car, police said. The driver was held after the police traced him through the car's number plate details. "BMW is in the name of accused, Ashwani Lal, who lives in Indirapuram, Ghaziabad,” said DCP (east) Priyanka Kashyap.

286.title: New mayor appointed in Ukraine's Melitopol after predecessor kidnapped
286.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has appointed Galina Danilchenko as the new mayor of Melitopol city after the elected mayor Ivan Fedorov was reportedly kidnapped by the Russian military. The country's foreign ministry has condemned Fedorov's abduction, calling it a gross violation of international law and a war crime under the Geneva Conventions.

287.title: Many big names in Karnataka to join party soon: AAP's Prithvi Reddy
287.article_body: In four to six weeks, many big names in Karnataka will be joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), party leader Prithvi Reddy said while adding that an announcement for the same would be made soon. The party will identify candidates for next year's Assembly elections early so that they could work on their respective constituencies, Reddy added.

288.title: Paytm founder held, released on bail in Feb for ramming car into police vehicle
288.article_body: Paytm CEO and founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma was arrested and released on bail by Delhi Police last month after being booked for rash and negligent driving. A Jaguar Land Rover allegedly being driven by Sharma had rammed into vehicle of DCP (South district) outside The Mother’s International School on Aurobindo Marg. The police also impounded the car after the accident.

289.title: UK shares latest map of Ukraine showing areas controlled by Russia
289.article_body: The UK's Ministry of Defence has shared the latest map of Ukraine showing areas controlled by Russia. The Russian troops have surrounded Mariupol, a port city on the Sea of Azov and are close to cutting off the country's second-largest city Kharkiv. The map also shows the likely axis of advance of the Russian troops.

290.title: China reports highest COVID-19 cases in 2 years with more than 3,300 infections
290.article_body: China reported more than 3,300 COVID-19 infections on Saturday as the country faces its worst outbreak since the early days of the pandemic, Bloomberg reported. There were 1,807 confirmed local infections, 1,315 asymptomatic local cases and more than 200 imported cases, the National Health Commission said on Sunday. The northeastern province of Jilin accounted for more than 2,100 cases.

291.title: 19 cow carcasses found near railway track in Punjab; probe ordered
291.article_body: At least 19 headless cow carcasses, with their skins removed, have been found at an abandoned place near a railway track on Saturday in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, SP (Investigation) Mukhtiar Rai said. Following this, a two-member committee was formed to probe the matter. Political leaders also blocked traffic in a protest over the incident and lifted the blockade after police assurance.

292.title: Australia record their biggest win by runs against NZ in Women's World Cups
292.article_body: Australia recorded their biggest win (by runs) against New Zealand in Women's ODI World Cups after beating them by 141 runs in the ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. Australia posted 269/8 in 50 overs and then restricted New Zealand to 128/10 in 30.2 overs with Darcie Brown picking three wickets. It's Australia's third straight win in the tournament.

293.title: Over 700 exotic birds kept in cages for illegal sale rescued in Tamil Nadu
293.article_body: Forest department officials in Tamil Nadu's Trichy conducted raids at various locations in a crackdown against illegal trade of exotic birds. Officials said over 600 green parrots and 100 starlings were kept in cages for sale in Trichy. The accused who were engaged in the illegal trade of exotic birds will be fined under Wild Life (Protection) Act, officials added.

294.title: One of the quicker bowlers has to be workhorse, Shami does that: Gavaskar
294.article_body: With India restricting Sri Lanka to 86/6 at stumps on Day 1 in the ongoing second Test, Sunil Gavaskar called Mohammad Shami a "workhorse", praising his ability to bowl long spells while maintaining pace. "Shami is somebody who can bowl long spells, sustain that pace, and can build pressure...You need somebody like that. He has been terrific," Gavaskar added.

295.title: India reports 3,116 new COVID-19 cases, 47 deaths in 24 hours
295.article_body: India has reported 3,116 new COVID-19 cases and 47 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 3,614 cases and 89 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 38,069, while the death toll in the country reached 5,15,850.

296.title: KTR warns of cutting power supply to Secunderabad military area
296.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday warned that water and power supply to the military authorities in the Secunderabad Cantonment area will be cut if they don't stop causing inconvenience to the people. It's "not fair" for the military authorities to close roads whenever they want, he added. A BJP spokesperson called Rao's remarks "shocking".

297.title: Holi celebrations to be held in Gr Noida City Park on March 16; entry free
297.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority will organise a two-hour long event to celebrate Holi in City Park on March 16. The event will be held from 5 pm to 7 pm and the entry will be free, said GNIDA. The event will feature Mathura's Charkula and Gagri dance recitals and a performance by Braj folk singer Dr Seema Morwal.

298.title: 4 members of inter-state drug peddling gang arrested in Ludhiana
298.article_body: The Ludhiana Police busted an inter-state drug peddling gang allegedly involved in the supply of ganja (cannabis), poppy husk and opium into Punjab. Police have arrested four members of the gang and claimed recovery of 2.04 quintals of ganja, 3 kg poppy husk and 500 grams of opium from them, allegedly smuggled from Odisha.

299.title: Assam man lynched, set on fire by mob for allegedly killing 5-yr-old child
299.article_body: A 35-year-old man, accused of killing a child, was allegedly lynched and later set on fire by a mob in a paddy field in Assam's Dibrugarh on Saturday. The incident took place after the accused allegedly stabbed a five-year-old child to death with a machete at a tea estate, police said. The mob attacked the accused with machetes and sticks.

300.title: Ronaldo breaks world record for scoring most goals in football history, claim Man Utd
300.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a hat-trick for Manchester United against Tottenham Hotspur in Premier League on Saturday, taking his tally of professional goals for club and country to 807. As per Manchester United, Ronaldo broke the world record for scoring most goals in football history. Ronaldo surpassed late Austro-Czech footballer Josef Bican, who's estimated to have scored 805 goals by FIFA.

301.title: 12 missiles fired towards US consulate in Iraq from Iran: Officials
301.article_body: Twelve missiles were fired towards the US consulate in Iraq's northern city of Irbil on Sunday, Iraqi security officials said. A US defense official said missiles had been launched from neighbouring Iran. Another US official said there was no damage and no casualties at any US government facility, but Iraqi officials said several missiles had hit the US consulate.

302.title: People understood BJP should come to power if development is needed: Smriti Irani
302.article_body: After BJP’s victory in four of the five states where polls were held recently, Union Minister Smriti Irani said people understood that if they need development in the country, the BJP government should come to power. Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav’s EVM allegation, Irani said that EVMs were just an excuse.

303.title: You can't play negative shots or just keep defending: Iyer on 92(98) vs SL
303.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer, who smashed 10 fours and 4 sixes in his 92-run knock to help India post 252 in their first innings against Sri Lanka, has said batting with a defensive mindset doesn't help on turning wickets. "My plan...was to cut down the spin (negate turn), so I decided to step out [while batting]," he added.

304.title: 'The Kashmir Files' makers Vivek Agnihotri, Abhishek Agarwal meet PM Modi
304.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' team, including director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, actress Pallavi Joshi and producer Abhishek Agarwal, met PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. Abhishek took to Twitter to share some pictures from the meeting and wrote, "It was a pleasure to meet our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi. What makes it more special is his...noble words about #TheKashmirFiles...Thank you, Modi Ji."

305.title: 21-yr-old DU graduate found hanging in Delhi; probe on
305.article_body: A 21-year-old man who graduated from Delhi University's Hansraj College was found hanging from a ceiling fan in Delhi's Vijay Nagar. The body was found by his flatmate and locals. The police said they didn't find any suicide note and started a probe. The man reportedly hailed from UP and had recently landed a job in Noida.

306.title: Pune police file 3,500-page chargesheet in MHADA paper leak case
306.article_body: Pune police have filed a 3,500-page chargesheet against the director of a private firm and two agents in connection with the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) paper leak case. The three - Dr Pritesh Deshmukh, Ankush Harkal and Santosh Harkal - have been accused of seeking lakhs of rupees from candidates in a recruitment drive for 565 posts.

307.title: Chhattisgarh teacher comes to school drunk, beats students with bat; suspended
307.article_body: A school teacher in Chhattisgarh allegedly reached school drunk and beat the students with a cricket bat, according to the District Collector. Following the incident, the District Collector issued an order suspending the teacher with immediate effect. The incident took place on March 10, when the teacher arrived at the school after consuming liquor.

308.title: 20-yr-old Gr Noida man shoots sister dead for objecting to his drinking habits
308.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her 20-year-old brother at their residence in Greater Noida for objecting to his drinking habits. Police said the accused had come home intoxicated and had started puking when his sister scolded him. The accused, who had a pistol with him, started arguing with her and later escaped after shooting her dead.

309.title: Virat wants to enjoy his time at RCB as batsman, we respect that: Hesson
309.article_body: Talking about their decision to appoint Faf du Plessis as captain for the upcoming season, RCB's Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said it was clear that Virat Kohli wanted a break, which is why he stepped down as captain after last season. "Virat wants to enjoy his time as a batsman and we are very respectful of that," Hesson added.

310.title: Pune police arrest 2 cyber experts for misleading cryptocurrency probe
310.article_body: Pune police have arrested two cyber experts for allegedly misleading a probe into a cryptocurrency cheating case in which 17 people were arrested. The two, who were expected to assist police in the case, transferred seized cryptocurrency from national and international wallets to themselves and their partners, said police. One of them allegedly submitted manipulated screenshots to the police.

311.title: 2 assault watchman, steal ₹1.6 lakh-material from firm in Pune
311.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 68-year-old watchman with a sharp weapon and a brick and then stealing material worth about ₹1.6 lakh from a steel firm in Pune. A police official said that the duo had apparently scaled the main gate to enter the premises and later opened the gate to let their other accomplices in.

312.title: Bengaluru traffic police officer helps 80-yr-old man find his home
312.article_body: Bengaluru's Rajajinagar Traffic Police Station on Sunday tweeted that a traffic police officer, who was on duty in the area, had helped an 80-year-old man who'd gone missing from his house. It said that the police officer had tracked down the man's home and contacted his family by phone. The traffic police station also shared a picture of the incident.

313.title: Ukraine shares 'Spider-Man' meme to show damaged Russian tank
313.article_body: The official Twitter account of Ukraine shared a 'Spider-Man' meme to show a damaged Russian tank. Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed over 12,000 Russian soldiers, destroyed 362 Russian tanks and 1,205 armoured vehicles of other types amid the war. Russia had started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

314.title: Virat Kohli's gestures to Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' go viral
314.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli's gestures to the Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' during the second India-Sri Lanka Test have gone viral. Kohli was seen making a heart sign with his hands as the crowd chanted 'RCB RCB'. Kohli also pulled up his Team India shirt to reveal a red coloured apparel below it as the crowd chanted for RCB.

315.title: Mumbai psychologist held for selling brownies laced with hashish, opium denied bail
315.article_body: A special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) court has rejected a 24-year-old psychologist's bail plea, who was arrested with 10 kilograms of hashish-laden brownies. The accused was practising in a renowned hospital in south Mumbai. Mumbai's Narcotics Control Bureau unit claimed that the accused baked brownies with a mixture of hashish and opium and supplied them to several clients.

316.title: Satellite images show fires, damage to residential buildings in Ukraine
316.article_body: Satellite images showed damage to civilian infrastructure and residential buildings throughout the Ukrainian city of Mariupol. Maxar Technologies said fires were seen in the western section of the Black Sea port city and several high-rise buildings had been severely damaged. Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said Mariupol was besieged by Russian forces but was still under Ukrainian control.

317.title: Hailey Bieber hospitalised after suffering brain-related 'medical emergency'
317.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, the wife of singer Justin Bieber, was reportedly hospitalised with a brain condition that could possibly be linked to COVID-19. As per reports, Hailey, who has been discharged, was admitted after suffering a "medical emergency" that affected the way she moved. A report claimed that 25-year-old Hailey showed symptoms that were more typical of an older person.

318.title: 31-year-old woman blown up by Russian tank as she went to get medicine for sick mother
318.article_body: A 31-year-old Ukrainian woman named Valeriia Maksetska, who was leaving her Kyiv home to collect medicine for her sick mother, was reportedly blown up by a Russian tank. She was allegedly killed alongside her mother and driver in a village near Kyiv. USAID administrator Samantha Power tweeted that they were waiting in a car for a Russian convoy to pass.

319.title: French woman alleges sexual abuse by Kerala tattoo artist accused in 6 other cases
319.article_body: A French national has alleged that she was sexually abused by Sujeesh PS who was arrested after several female clients accused him of crimes including rape. The woman claimed she was abused by Sujeesh in 2019 during a trip to Kochi, police said. Six cases were registered against him after an 18-year-old opened up about being raped by him.

320.title: Couldn't be happier to pass on baton: Kohli on Du Plessis as new RCB captain
320.article_body: Reacting to Faf du Plessis' appointment as the new RCB captain, Virat Kohli said he couldn't be "happier" to pass on the baton to a "good friend". He added, "We've been in touch for many years now...absolutely excited for him to lead RCB and to play under him." Kohli had stepped down as RCB's captain after IPL 2021.

321.title: Ranveer Singh gets 'Number 1' jersey from football icon Ledley King, pic viral
321.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who is currently in the UK to attend the Premier League games, shared a picture with Tottenham legend Ledley King. Ledley gifted Ranveer a customised 'Number 1' jersey. The actor also opted to do the 'Dare Skywalk' at the stadium and shared that the "42 metre drop over the edge of the grand stadium" was "exhilarating".

322.title: Man throws son from 2nd floor after fire in US house; video shows police catching him
322.article_body: A man threw his three-year-old son from the second floor window of an apartment building on fire before jumping out to officers below. A video of the incident shows the police officers and firefighters catching the boy. "Pass the baby down...we got it," the officers could be heard saying in the video.

323.title: Punjab people's security more important than security of few: Mann
323.article_body: After an order was issued to withdraw security cover of 122 politicians including former MLAs and ministers, Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann said, "I think the security of the people of Punjab is more important than the security of few people." He added police stations are lying vacant. "We will take only police work from police force," the AAP leader said.

324.title: Ukraine bans export of fertilisers amid conflict with Russia
324.article_body: Ukraine, a major global producer of agricultural products, on Saturday banned the exports of fertilisers amid Russia's invasion of the country. The ban would help "to maintain balance in the domestic market" and applied to nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium and complex fertilisers, the country's Agriculture Ministry said. Earlier, Ukraine had banned exports of some agricultural commodities.

325.title: A brand new start for me in a new franchise: RCB captain Du Plessis
325.article_body: Newly-appointed RCB captain Faf du Plessis has said representing the franchise is a challenge for him as it's a brand new start for him in a new franchise. The 37-year-old, who until last year represented CSK, was picked by Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹7 crore at IPL mega auction last month. "So excited at [all] levels," Du Plessis added.

326.title: World's 5th richest person Buffett got $373,000 in compensation for 2021
326.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman and CEO Warren Buffett received $373,204 in compensation for 2021, including his salary and security cost, down from $380,328 a year ago. Buffett's 16.2% stake in Berkshire comprises most of his $117.9 billion net worth, making him the world's fifth richest person. Buffett has been receiving an annual salary of $100,000 for more than four decades now.

327.title: Man shot dead after injuring 3 French police officers in knife attack
327.article_body: A French man was shot dead by the police in France's Marseille after he attacked them with a knife on Saturday, leaving three police officers injured, authorities said. French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said that the attacker was not known to the police and had no police record. The motive for the attack was not immediately known.

328.title: Want to create digital blockade: Ukraine Vice PM as he asks firms to pull out of Russia
328.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov, who has been urging tech companies to pull out of Russia, said his goal is to create a "digital blockade" so that Russians question the war. The 31-year-old minister in an interview revealed that he has been worried about his father, who has been in intensive care after a missile struck the house next door.

329.title: 15 fire tenders mobilised as massive fire breaks out at Kolkata tannery
329.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Kolkata's Tangra on Saturday and 15 fire tenders reached the spot to douse the flames. Two fire brigade personnel were injured during the firefighting operations and were rushed to the hospital. Although the situation is under control, the extent of damage isn't known yet, an official said.

330.title: K'taka man attacks wife for filing divorce after learning about 1st wife
330.article_body: A man in Karnataka, Mohammad Ejaz Shiroor, has been arrested for allegedly attacking his wife Apoorva Puranik alias Arfa Bhanu on Thursday in Gadag district after she sought divorce. The victim, who changed her name after the wedding, had learnt about a year ago that Ejaz was already married and had three kids. The divorce matter was listed for Friday.

331.title: Baldwin tried to reach settlement to finish filming 'Rust': Report
331.article_body: Actor-producer Alec Baldwin had tried to reach a settlement to finish the filming of 'Rust' after a shooting incident which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins. Alec has submitted a filing which states that the cast and crew did not want to return to New Mexico. It further states that Baldwin convinced them to finish filming to honour Halyna's talent and legacy.

332.title: Central Railway earns ₹2.48 cr in 2021-2022 from film shootings
332.article_body: In the 2021-22 financial year, Central Railway earned over ₹2.48 crore by offering its premises and coaches for film shootings. It's the highest-ever revenue for any financial year, with Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) being the most prefered location. Different locations of Central Railway witnessed the shooting of ten films, two web series and a short film during the year.

333.title: Not a surprise to me: ABD on Faf du Plessis being named RCB captain
333.article_body: After RCB named Faf du Plessis as their captain ahead of IPL 2022, ex-South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers said, "The announcement comes as no surprise to me after RCB picked up Faf at...[mega] auction." He added that Du Plessis is an "amazing leader and the perfect man" for the job. "He has a fantastic tactical mind," he further said.

334.title: Moscow-Kyiv crisis talks have continued via video link: Kremlin
334.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Saturday said crisis talks between Moscow and Kyiv have continued via video link after in-person talks held in Belarus, reported RIA news agency. Peskov added Russian President Vladimir Putin briefed French President Emmanuel Macron, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on the negotiations held recently. Meanwhile, UN said 579 civilians were killed in Ukraine so far.

335.title: Paytm Payments Bank issues statement after RBI bars it from taking new customers
335.article_body: A day after RBI directed Paytm Payments Bank to stop onboarding new customers with immediate effect, the company issued a statement saying they are taking immediate steps to comply with RBI directions. It added, "We shall notify when we recommence the opening of new accounts after obtaining RBI approval." It also said the accounts of existing customers are fully functional.

336.title: 579 civilians including 42 children killed in Ukraine so far: UN
336.article_body: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Saturday said 579 civilians, including 42 children, were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24. The office added over 1,000 others were injured so far. As per OHCHR, most civilians were killed due to use of explosive weapons such as heavy artillery shelling and missile strikes.

337.title: India lose 1-2 vs Germany in shootout at Women's Pro Hockey League
337.article_body: India lost 1-2 to Germany in a shootout after both the teams were tied at 1-1 at the end of 60-minute regulation time in first match of double-leg FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Bhubaneswar on Saturday. Navneet Kaur, who scored the goal for India in the fourth minute, hit the only goal for her side in the shootout.

338.title: People are behaving as if I have no other work: Archana on memes on her & Sidhu
338.article_body: Archana Puran Singh, speaking about memes after Navjot Singh Sidhu lost in Punjab Assembly elections, told ETimes, "When there's something new happening to Sidhu, memes are made on me. Isn't that strange?" "People...are behaving as if I only have this job...and no other work...If...Sidhu decides to come back [on The Kapil Sharma Show] I'm willing to move on," she added.

339.title: 16 wickets fall on Day 1 of Day-Night Test, Sri Lanka trail India by 166 runs
339.article_body: As many as 16 wickets fell on the Day 1 of Day-Night Test between India and Sri Lanka in Bengaluru as Sri Lanka ended the day at 86/6, trailing India by 166 runs. Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets, while Mohammad Shami picked two. Earlier in the day, India were dismissed for 252 in first innings with Shreyas Iyer scoring 92(98).

340.title: Reduction in EPFO interest rate BJP's return gift after poll win: Cong
340.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said the reduction in Employees' Provident Fund Organisation interest rate was a "return gift" of the BJP to people after it won Assembly elections in four states. "Is it right to attack...savings of crores of employees on...basis of electoral victory?" he asked. EPFO has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1%.

341.title: Earlier you were asked to compromise to bag roles: Ekta Jain
341.article_body: Actress Ekta Jain in an interview has stated that actresses were earlier asked to compromise to bag roles which had put her off. "The circumstances at that time were really tough for television actors," the actress added. Ekta further said that the industry has drastically transformed and now people are looking for talent and good artistes instead of stars.

342.title: Former Zambian President Rupiah Banda passes away at 85
342.article_body: Former Zambian President Rupiah Bwezani Banda passed away on Friday at his home in capital Lusaka at the age of 85 after a two-year battle with colon cancer. Banda's death was confirmed by his son, Andrew and Zambia's current President Hakainde Hichilema. "We appreciate his service to the nation," Hichilema said during a televised address to the nation.

343.title: RS to get 19 hrs of extra work time in upcoming Budget session
343.article_body: The Rajya Sabha will get 19 hours of additional time for business over the earlier schedule in the second part of the Budget session that is set to begin from March 14. The House will sit from 11 am till 6 pm, with a one-hour lunch break. The first part of the Budget session had concluded on February 11.

344.title: Azim Premji forgives person who filed 70 cases against him; SC praises him
344.article_body: The Supreme Court praised former Wipro Chairman Azim Hasham Premji after he agreed to forgive the person who through his companies filed over 70 cases against Premji and his associates. "We're happy to note that Mr Azim Hasham Premji has taken a constructive view of the matter and agreed to forgive the past conduct of Mr Subramanian," the court said.

345.title: I apologise to Kashmiri Hindus for my indifference: The Kashmir Files' Prakash
345.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' actor Prakash Belawadi has posted a video apologising to the Kashmiri Pandits for his "indifference" to their mass exodus from the state. "I feel mortified, I also feel guilty as I was a journalist at that time and prided myself as someone equipped with...contemporary events, but I see it was not the case," the actor said.

346.title: Ukraine shares how it's spending crypto donations, says 'they're saving lives'
346.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Minister of Digital Transformation Alex Bornyakov tweeted, "Each and every helmet and vest bought via crypto donations is currently saving Ukrainian soldiers' lives." He said the funds are being used to buy bulletproof vests, helmets, thermal imagers and optics, medicines, and packed lunches for Ukraine's armed forces. Ukraine has received nearly $100 million in crypto donations.

347.title: Saudi Arabia executes 81 people in 1 day in its biggest mass execution
347.article_body: Saudi Arabia on Saturday executed 81 people who were convicted of various terror offences. This marked the kingdom's largest-known mass execution in its modern history. Saturday's executions exceeded the total number of executions in Saudi Arabia in the whole of last year. Saudi state television described those executed as having "followed the footsteps of Satan" in carrying out the crimes.

348.title: Vietnam bans Sony's 'Uncharted' over disputed South China Sea map
