348.article_body: Sony's action movie "Uncharted" has been banned in Vietnam over a scene featuring a disputed map of the South China Sea. The scene shows the U-shaped "nine-dash line" that is used by China to stake its claim to large parts of the sea. China's claim in the sea includes areas claimed by other countries in the region.

349.title: Turkmenistan President's son likely to win snap presidential election
349.article_body: Serdar Berdimuhamedov, son of Turkmenistan's President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov, is likely to win Saturday's snap presidential election. Currently, Deputy Prime Minister, 40-year-old Serdar has been facing token competition from eight other nominal candidates in the vote. In power since 2007, President Berdimuhamedov called the snap election last month paving way for a generation of new leaders.

350.title: US using bats and birds as biological weapons, claims Russia
350.article_body: Russia has accused the US and Ukraine at the UN security council of a plot to use migratory birds and bats to spread pathogens. Russia's UN ambassador, Vassily Nebenzia, said the birds, bats and insects would cross Ukraine's western border. The UN said it was "not aware of any biological weapons programmes" in Ukraine.

351.title: K'taka Cong leader resigns, says, 'Couldn't speak to Sonia or Rahul'
351.article_body: CM Ibrahim, former Union Minister and senior Congress leader from Karnataka, tendered his resignation to party's interim chief Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. He said despite being a senior leader, he couldn't speak to Sonia or former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi directly. He said Sonia assured him of changes within Congress in the last 12 years, but he didn't see them.

352.title: Meta cuts on-site perks including free laundry, valet service for employees
352.article_body: Meta Platforms, Facebook's parent company, has informed its employees about cutting down various on-site perks including free laundry, dry cleaning and valet service. The company also announced that it would delay the free dinner time from 6 pm to 6:30 pm. While Meta offered a remote work option, many employees are scheduled to return to the office on March 28.

353.title: Can't blame Kohli for the way he got out: Parthiv on India-SL 2nd Test
353.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's LBW dismissal on Day 1 of second Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Sri Lanka, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said the ex-captain can't be blamed for the way he got out. "Pitch is so bad that he could've done nothing about it...ball was spinning...kept a bit low," he added. Off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva took Kohli's wicket.

354.title: Guatemala receives first arrivals of Ukrainians fleeing war
354.article_body: Guatemala on Friday received first arrivals of Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion in their homeland. The eight Ukrainians were the first to arrive in the Central American country for humanitarian reasons, an immigration spokesperson said. The officials added another flight carrying more Ukrainians arrived hours later. Meanwhile, UN said over 2.6 million Ukrainians fled the country so far.

355.title: AAP to contest all 68 seats in Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections
355.article_body: After a win in Punjab, Aam Aadmi Party said it'll contest all 68 seats in the Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. AAP leader Satyendar Jain said that health and education systems are in a bad state in Himachal Pradesh, adding that AAP will form the government in the state. Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections are scheduled to be held in November.

356.title: Completely incorrect: Congress as report claims Rahul, Sonia and Priyanka will resign
356.article_body: Congress has dismissed a report claiming that Congress President Sonia Gandhi and leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will resign at Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday over performance in recent elections. Congress Spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said the report "based on unnamed sources is completely unfair, mischievous and incorrect".

357.title: UN is negotiating to create aid corridors in Ukraine: Official
357.article_body: The United Nations is negotiating with both sides in the conflict in Ukraine to create corridors to deliver aid, the UN's crisis coordinator for the European country said. As many as 12 million Ukrainians may need aid, the official added. The most pressing humanitarian needs are in Mariupol, a besieged city in eastern Ukraine, the official further said.

358.title: He could've funded it himself: Lawyer on Musk's 'taking Tesla private' tweet
358.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer told a US court the billionaire is rich enough that he could've funded Tesla's going-private transaction himself. He was referring to Musk's 2018 tweet claiming he was considering taking Tesla private and that he had secured the funding. The lawyer said, "None of Musk's deals have ever had a funding issue...[He has] great personal resources."

359.title: RCB unveil their new jersey with stylised lion, share pics
359.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) have unveiled their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The jersey includes a stylised lion at the back. RCB announced that they have simplified their jersey as compared to the previous kit. RCB will face Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

360.title: Agreed to maintain stability: India, China after 15th round of talks
360.article_body: After holding the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on Friday, India and China released a joint statement, claiming that both sides agreed to maintain stability on the ground in the western sector. "They agreed to maintain dialogue via military and diplomatic channels to reach a mutually acceptable resolution of the remaining issues at the earliest," the statement read.

361.title: 13 states/UTs record 'above normal' temperatures in last 24 hours; IMD releases list
361.article_body: The IMD has released the names of 13 states/UTs that recorded 'above normal' maximum temperatures in the last 24 hours. The regions include Gujarat, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Goa, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura. Moreover, heat wave conditions are likely in Saurashtra-Kutch, interior Odisha and west Rajasthan over the next few days.

362.title: 2 men crowdfund money to buy Caribbean island & start their own nation
362.article_body: Gareth Johnson and Marshall Mayer launched a crowdfunding campaign and raised £250,000 (₹2.5 crore) to purchase an uninhabited island in the Caribbean. They completed the purchase of Coffee Caye, a 1.2-acre island off the coast of Belize. The island, albeit not officially recognised as a nation, is named 'Principality of Islandia' and has its own national flag, anthem and government.

363.title: He used to ask for movie tickets: Bellamkonda Suresh on ₹85 lakh cheating case
363.article_body: Telugu producer Bellamkonda Suresh, responding to the ₹85 lakh cheating case against him, said VL Sravan Kumar is from his village and used to ask for movie tickets. Kumar alleged that Suresh and his son took money from him in 2018 to make a movie. "I've not taken a single penny from anyone...I will file a defamation case," Suresh said.

364.title: People of Russia not the enemy: Mila amid Russian invasion of Ukraine
364.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis, speaking about Russia's invasion of Ukraine, has said the people of Russia are not the enemy, adding that it's not being said enough in the press. She was born in Ukraine in 1983 and moved to USA in 1991. Mila added she felt like a part of her heart got ripped out after hearing about the attacks.

365.title: Didn't bowl as wanted, gave many short balls: Stafanie on WI's loss
365.article_body: West Indies captain Stafanie Taylor said her side didn't bowl the way they wanted to following their 155-run loss against India in Women's World Cup. "Gave away too many short balls...Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana batted really well. We just couldn't get back from that," she added. Chasing a 318-run target, West Indies were all-out for 162 in 40.3 overs.

366.title: S Korea logs record over 3.8 lakh new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
366.article_body: South Korean health authorities on Saturday said the country reported 3,83,665 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, logging its highest single-day tally since the pandemic began. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), Gyeonggi province reported 1,07,943 infections, whereas capital Seoul recorded 80,437 cases. KDCA added that 269 deaths were reported in the same period.

367.title: UK-based startup Space Forge aim to launch country's 1st satellite
367.article_body: UK-based startup Space Forge and Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit may launch Britain's first satellite over this summer. "We're thrilled to be making UK history with our first launch," said Space Forge CEO Joshua Western. The CEO added that this is the start of a great collaboration. Space Forge's microgravity satellite, ForgeStar will be launched aboard Virgin Orbit's LauncherOne rocket.

368.title: Caribbean coral reefs have been warming for at least 100 years: Study
368.article_body: US researchers stated Caribbean coral reefs have been warming for at least 100 years. The team analysed sea-surface temperatures and revealed that the reefs were warming since 1915. However, they added that in four out of eight sub-regions, warming may have started during second half of nineteenth century. The team studied 5,326 coral reefs across eight Caribbean regions.

369.title: Elon Musk keeps his word: Ukraine Vice PM after receiving 2nd shipment of Starlink
369.article_body: Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to thank Tesla CEO Elon Musk after receiving the second shipment of Starlink terminals. Fedorov tweeted, "Received the second shipment of Starlink stations! Elon Musk keeps his word! Thank you for supporting Ukraine and peace in the entire world!" SpaceX had delivered the first batch of Starlink to Ukraine earlier this month.

370.title: Germany, Qatar discuss bilateral cooperation in energy, investments
370.article_body: Jörg Kukies, State Secretary to German Chancellery on Saturday said the government discussed bilateral cooperation in energy and corporate investments with Qatar. Kukies added he held talks with Qatar's Deputy Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani on March 9. This comes as the German government has been working to lessen the country's reliance on Russian oil and gas.

371.title: Putin may pay the price with armed escort to grave or retirement: Ex-Russian Minister
371.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, former Russian Minister Andrei Kozyrev has said President Vladimir Putin might "pay the price with an armed escort either to the grave or to retirement". "With Putin, I very much expect there to be resistance growing...that will be resolved one way or another...I don't know which way but Russian history is full of unexpected outcomes," he added.

372.title: Look into the eyes of our defenders: Ukraine as it shares pics of people fighting Russia
372.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has shared a collage of people fighting against Russia amid the war. "Look into the eyes of our defenders," the post's caption read. "There is no fear in their eyes...God bless all of Ukraine," a comment read while another Twitter user wrote, "I see love, life and determination in their eyes. Ukraine will win."

373.title: Woman beheads husband & keeps head in family temple in Tripura, arrested
373.article_body: A 42-year-old woman allegedly beheaded her 50-year-old husband and kept the blood-soaked head in a plastic bag at the family's temple in Tripura's Khowai on Saturday, a police officer said. The couple's elder son said that his mother developed a psychological disorder and underwent treatment by a local occultist. She has been arrested, police said.

374.title: Ex-bank manager among 12 sent to jail in loan fraud case in Hyd
374.article_body: A special court for CBI cases in Hyderabad has sentenced 12 people, including a former bank manager, to jail for up to five years in a housing loan fraud case dating back to 2004. The ex-manager of a Central Bank of India branch was identified as the main accused. He was asked to pay a fine of ₹2.25 lakh.

375.title: What worked for us was our approach, attitude: Mithali on India's win vs WI
375.article_body: Praising India after they defeated West Indies by 155 runs in 2022 Women's World Cup, India skipper Mithali Raj said she couldn't have asked for a better effort from her side. "Everybody knew about the importance of this game...what worked for us was our approach and attitude," she added. India's 317/8 was their highest-ever total in a Women's World Cup.

376.title: Man cheated of ₹4.3 lakh in Mumbai by woman claiming to be doctor
376.article_body: A 33-year-old bank officer working in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹4.30 lakh by a woman, who befriended him on Facebook and claimed she was a London-based doctor. The accused made him believe that she needed money to clear customs and he paid money frequently. On realising that he was cheated, he approached Kalachowki Police and registered a complaint.

377.title: Bengaluru can't grow in an unplanned way: Karnataka CM Bommai
377.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said the state capital, Bengaluru, can't grow in an unplanned way. He took to Twitter and said, "We need to develop high class, smart and self-sufficient [Satellite Towns] with hi-tech communication systems, that offer ease of living, travelling and of doing business and intermediate specific cities [like] health cities and education cities etc."

378.title: Pakistan seeks joint probe into accidental missile fire by India
378.article_body: Pakistan on Saturday demanded a joint probe into the incident involving the accidental firing of an Indian missile into its territory. "Such a serious matter cannot be addressed with the simplistic explanation proffered by the Indian authorities," said Pakistan's foreign office. India had blamed a "technical malfunction" during routine maintenance for the missile fire.

379.title: Woman submits fake educational documents to get job in Pune; booked
379.article_body: A woman allegedly forged educational documents to secure a job with the Maharashtra Police in place of her husband after his death in Pune. The woman reportedly wanted to get a job in the Criminal Investigation Department of Maharashtra Police as her husband was a police sub-inspector in the fingerprint department of CID. She has now been booked by police.

380.title: Hyd Traffic Police's green channel helps transport of live organs
380.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police on Saturday created a green channel to facilitate the transport of live organs from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Shamshabad to KIMS Hospitals in Begumpet. The channel was created in coordination with Cyberabad Traffic Police. "We would like to thank...Hyderabad Traffic Police and Cyberabad Traffic Police for providing a green channel," KIMS Hospitals tweeted.

381.title: Pics from space show Ukrainian shopping centre before & after Russian invasion
381.article_body: Satellite pictures by Maxar Technologies show the destruction caused after Russian invasion of Ukraine. Before and after pictures show a shopping centre in Ukraine's Chernihiv completely damaged after Russian invasion. "This is the first time in my life when I have to excavate the graves to bury five coffins together," city's mayor Vladyslav Atroshenko said.

382.title: China allows COVID antigen self-test kits for 1st time as daily cases hit 2-yr high
382.article_body: China for the first time has permitted the use of COVID-19 antigen self-test kits for the general public. It has granted approval to five COVID-19 antigen kits made by local companies for this. On Friday, China reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily count in around two years.

383.title: 122 former MLAs, ministers lose security day after Mann meets Punjab DGP
383.article_body: A day after Bhagwant Mann, who is set to become Punjab CM, met state DGP VK Bhawra, the Additional Director General of Police (Security) issued an order to withdraw security cover of 122 politicians, including former ministers and MLAs. Nineteen security officers were withdrawn from Manpreet Singh Badal's cover. A Congress leader, Badal served as Punjab's Finance Minister.

384.title: IISc B'luru develops paper-based sensor to detect hydrogen peroxide
384.article_body: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru, have developed a simpler way, a paper-based sensor, for detecting even tiny volumes of hydrogen peroxide. The chemical is widely used in products like hand sanitiser as a disinfectant. The paper-based sensor can reportedly be used to check household and healthcare products' quality and for testing biological fluids like blood.

385.title: 2 arrested for hitting Delhi Police constable with beer bottle
385.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that it has arrested two people, who had allegedly hit a police constable with a beer bottle. The incident had taken place on Thursday, March 10, in the Sarai Rohilla area. The police constable had asked the accused to not play loud music inside a car. Subsequently, they hit him and fled.

386.title: Deepika Padukone criticised for saying she was 'made to feel like a person of colour'
386.article_body: Deepika Padukone's recent Instagram caption, wherein she wrote that she was "made to feel like a person of colour", has been criticised by some social media users. "What does she want to tell? That being called...a person of colour is an insult? And she's a white?" a Twitter user wrote. "The choice of words is so wrong," another comment read.

387.title: Being an MMA professional helps me empower other women: Ritu Phogat
387.article_body: India's mixed martial arts (MMA) fighter Ritu Phogat believes that her profession "helps her in empowering other women". Phogat, who has a 7-2 MMA career record, added, "This is my chance to inspire millions of young girls and women not just in India but across the globe." Phogat left wrestling and took up MMA by joining One Championship in 2019.

388.title: Virat Kohli's 'stunned' reaction after getting out goes viral
388.article_body: Virat Kohli's reaction after getting out for 23(48) against Sri Lanka on first day of Day-Night Test has gone viral. Kohli got LBW out on the bowling of off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva. The ball spun and stayed low and hit Kohli's pads. After the dismissal, Kohli appeared stunned and stared at the pitch before walking back to the pavilion.

389.title: At times, I was too scared to listen to myself: Elli AvrRam on a decade in India
389.article_body: Actress Elli AvrRam while talking about completing a decade in India said, "The only thing I would have done [differently] is, those few times where I was too scared to listen to my...heart." "Instead, I listened to others' opinions," she said, adding, "Maybe those experiences were needed for me to...learn, that your heart is your right way through life."

390.title: I am very excited for the season: DC's Sarfaraz ahead of IPL 2022
390.article_body: Batter Sarfaraz Khan, who was picked by Delhi Capitals for his base price of ₹20 lakh in IPL mega auction 2022, said he's very excited for upcoming IPL season. "It's because this is my first season for Delhi. I'll try to do well in whatever chances I get for the team," he stated. Sarfaraz has previously represented RCB and PBKS.

391.title: Scientists find new species of giant tortoise on Galapagos Islands
391.article_body: Ecuador's Galapagos National Park on Thursday said scientists found a new species of giant tortoise. The team compared DNA of tortoises that are currently living on Galapagos Islands with bones, shells collected from the species in 1906. They found nearly 8,000 tortoises, previously identified as Chelonoidis chathamensis matched a different lineage which may have belonged to an extinct species.

392.title: Will take in 2,500 Ukrainian refugees from Moldova: German minister
392.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Saturday said government will take in 2,500 Ukrainian refugees who had fled to Moldova amid Russia-Ukraine war. Baerbock added that a corridor would be set up through Romania to bring refugees to Germany, primarily by bus. Meanwhile, as per German Interior Ministry, nearly one lakh refugees have so far entered the country.

393.title: We had a long discussion about loss vs NZ before WI match: Mandhana
393.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana who scored 123(119) in the 2022 Women's World Cup match against West Indies, said the team had a "long discussion" about the previous defeat against New Zealand before the match. India Women beat West Indies by 155 runs having been defeated by 62 runs against New Zealand. Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109 runs off 107 balls.

394.title: Maha govt allocates ₹1,500 crore for Pune Ring Road project
394.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and Finance Minister Ajit Pawar on Friday said that the state government has allocated ₹1,500 crore for the acquisition of 1,900 hectares of land for the Pune Ring Road project. He claimed that the project will help divert heavy traffic from entering Pune city. Separately, Pawar announced that Nashik-Pune railway project has been approved by the Centre.

395.title: Needed actor with gravitas, dignity: Bhansali on Ajay in 'Gangubai...'
395.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, speaking about the character Rahim Lala in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said that he needed an actor who exudes a certain gravitas, dignity and strength. "Ajay has all of this. The minute he walks into the film, audiences are with him," Bhansali added. The filmmaker further called the actor a director's delight and a considerate co-star.

396.title: Casting on OTT not based on star power, but on talent: Sanjay Kapoor
396.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor while talking about the casting process said, "It has got nothing to do with star power, but whether you are capable of delivering good." "It feels...good when you sign something on OTT. You know you are not being cast because of a certain value...your talent is enough," the actor added.

397.title: Meezaan Jafri to play lead role in Milap Zaveri's next: Reports
397.article_body: Actor Meezaan Jafri will reportedly star in 'Satyameva Jayate' director Milap Zaveri's next film. "Meezan is really excited to team up with...Milap Zaveri and Nikhil Advani. He loved the script and he will be seen in a never-before-seen avatar," reported Bollywood Hungama quoting a source. He will be seen playing the lead role in the romantic comedy, reports added.

398.title: EU, Turkish diplomats discuss Ukraine at diplomacy forum in Turkey
398.article_body: High Representative of the EU for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Josep Borrell Fontelles and Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Saturday discussed the situation in Ukraine at Antalya Diplomacy Forum. This comes after top diplomats from Russia and Ukraine held their first high-level talks on March 10. Meanwhile, UN said it recorded 549 civilian deaths in Ukraine so far.

399.title: Video shows long car queues outside McDonald's in Russia as brand shuts stores
399.article_body: A video showing long queues outside a McDonald's outlet in Moscow has surfaced on social media. McDonald’s has temporarily closed its 847 stores in the country over the Ukraine war. As per the company, the closure will cost it about $50 million a month. Meanwhile, people were also seen selling McDonald's burgers for high prices in Russia online.

400.title: 'Free Guy' director Shawn Levy to helm Ryan Reynolds' 'Deadpool 3'
400.article_body: Canadian filmmaker Shawn Levy has been roped in to direct Ryan Reynolds' third 'Deadpool' movie. Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick, who penned the screenplays for the first two movies, are also returning for the third instalment. Shawn and Ryan worked together in 'Free Guy' and the recently released action-adventure movie 'The Adam Project'.
